website_summaries.verdict: Constructed from quality wood, this instrument offers a better tone and response than most half-size guitars.
pros: Half-size guitar measures 25.6" long, for elementary age children
Nylon strings are gentle on inexperienced fingers
Constructed with spruce wood top, rosewood fingerboard and bridge
cons: Tuning knobs are not of high quality, but they get the job done

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size
customer_reviews.text: The size of this guitar is perfect for my 8 year old child who is learning to play guitar. Good quality and sound. The only thing that I wish this guitar has is a place where I can hook a strap because the guitar can be easily dropped by someone who is just starting to learn to play. I ordered a strap and had to cancel it because there is no place to hook the strap on this guitar.
customer_reviews.author: Kitty's Pretty

customer_reviews.title: I love this guitar!
customer_reviews.text: I am a 73-year-old woman with a degree in music (flute). Have long wanted to learn classical guitar (for my own enjoyment) but found full-size versions uncomfortable to play. I bought the Yamaha CGS102A half-size guitar 4 months ago and regard it as one of the best musical purchases I've ever made. It is comfortable to hold, has a lovely sound, and stays in tune well. I wasn’t sure how committed I would be about learning to play guitar, but my experience with this instrument has redoubled my enthusiasm. Thank you, Yamaha, for offering such a pleasing and affordable guitar!
customer_reviews.author: Soriguana

customer_reviews.title: Not real rosewood.
customer_reviews.text: The fret board is some stained wood and not real rosewood. It began to bleed color after afew months but after the return period. Real roeswood does not do this. Does not affect the performance of the guitar but incorrect description of materials. Did not expect it from a Yamaha product.
customer_reviews.author: Siddarth Jude Machado

customer_reviews.title: is much better. I never really cared for full sized guitars
customer_reviews.text: Bought this (1/2 size) originally as a travel guitar, but find that I am playing it almost exclusively now. It probably doesn't have the volume to project for a performance, but for personal play, there isn't a big difference in the sound from a full sized. The feel, is much better. I never really cared for full sized guitars, from the way it made my body torque, to the tension in my left hand. This is just *so* much more comfortable to play. I'm done with full-sized guitars - if I ever want to get another guitar, I'd go for a higher quality 1/2 or 3/4 size, but this is good enough.
customer_reviews.author: charcoal

customer_reviews.title: poor action
customer_reviews.text: It's made from home materials and has a nice sound. The issue is with the action with the fret board. Although the strings are nylon the distance it takes from the menu your fingers meet the strings and the frets takes its toll on young fingers. Also the notes begin to sound sharp as you climb up the neck.
customer_reviews.author: RW

customer_reviews.title: I like this guitar
customer_reviews.text: Good for adults too. I am kind of short and squat so this guitar's size makes learning do-able for me. The construction quality is perfect, the nylon strings are easy on my old fingers...I am so happy with this guitar!
customer_reviews.author: lou

customer_reviews.title: Great little guitar!
customer_reviews.text: Great little guitar for my 6 year-old. We had purchased 2 1/2 size electric guitars on Amazon. Both were garbage and couldn't hold a tune for longer than 10 minutes of playing. Both were returned. We finally tried this acoustic guitar and, while my son is a bit disappointed in not having an electric guitar, this little guitar sounds and plays well, and stays in tune!
customer_reviews.author: Bruce

customer_reviews.title: Great solid starter guitar for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great starter guitar. Bought for my daughter (2 years old) to play and learn on, she strums and pounds on it. Good size for little fingers, and she can hold it and walk around with it. I didn't expect much from the sound, for comparison I have a handmade flamenco Blanca, but was pleasantly surprised. Crisp, no buzzing, well made/manufactured guitar. This guitar obviously doesn't have top notch sound, but for a travel guitar, or a child's guitar, it's at a fantastic price and sound for a mass-produced guitar.
customer_reviews.author: jordan

customer_reviews.title: Best Guitar Value
customer_reviews.text: I’m not a guitarist, but own a music school and have bought several guitars for young beginners. This is the best quality guitar I have come across, hands down.
customer_reviews.author: Cathleen Arhelger

customer_reviews.title: Great starter guitar for a child
customer_reviews.text: I had wanted to get an Ibanez but it would have come too late for Santa to deliver it. My 4-year-old granddaughter had asked Santa for a guitar and we had decided to get her something that was not a toy. It is just the right size for her and it has a great tone. Her father is a musician and has been impressed with the tone and quality of this guitar. Great price for a very good guitar.
customer_reviews.author: Crzyoldone

customer_reviews.title: good starter
customer_reviews.text: I think this is a great starter guitar. Totally got it based on reviews and I liked the price. I feel it pays well and stays in tune (after you break the strings in) It's a good guitar by 6 year old can grow into. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: so well crafted its a Yamaha.
customer_reviews.text: okay this is my favorite guitar , i own all kinds and this one is so sweet and awsome. For everyone ,beginers will love it cause it will inspire them to play alot.
customer_reviews.author: b huffman

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for a starter guitar but hoped for more
customer_reviews.text: I play guitars and own several decent guitars. I wanted to start my kids on and I was willing. To pay a little more for a starter guitar. This is nice looking for the sound is pretty weak. It’s ok for them but I am not sure if it’s any better than a 60$ guitar
customer_reviews.author: Keyvan Azami

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful sound, easy to tune. Have been using for my 7 year old to learn guitar but I (petite female) am able to play it as well. Can't speak highly enough of this instrument!
customer_reviews.author: Bella James

customer_reviews.title: This is the perfect beginner guitar for young learners
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect beginner guitar for young learners. My 7-year-old has been using it and it is working well. It is durable, his instructor is happy with it (we sent others back to music stores), and it will be good to pass on to my next son.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Z.

customer_reviews.title: The ideal beginner/travel guitar
customer_reviews.text: The guitar is incredible quality for the price. I’m blown away. As a musician and music teacher this is what I will recommend from now on when anyone asks for a recommendation for beginners: smaller, more manageable size; easy-on-the-fingers nylon strings; great feel and sound!
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Hebert

customer_reviews.title: Excellent starter guitar
customer_reviews.text: Nylon strings can be challenging to keep tuned-however this one is not too bad. Great starter guitar for any age.
customer_reviews.author: Loria K.

customer_reviews.title: She doesn't have to use dad's guitar anymore
customer_reviews.text: Although i wasn't impressed by the price for a kids guitar, it seems to be very good quality and sounds pretty good. The half size fits my 7yo perfectly and she's so excited to have her own guitar
customer_reviews.author: Sarah H

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size for my child, quality item
customer_reviews.text: Christmas present for my 7 year old daughter. She absolutely loves it. It’s perfect for her size and years to come. It is a very nice piece. It’s not cheap. It’s the real deal if you want your child to take lessons, learn to care for a quality piece, and grow with. I did not want a $50 Hannah Montana cheap item. I got a quality guitar that is perfect for my child.
customer_reviews.author: D. Prime

customer_reviews.title: Great guitar for any beginner
customer_reviews.text: Great guitar for any beginner, and I know some advanced players that love using these too. I was using a 3/4 size before and was very hard to learn on, but quickly advanced once I started playing on this one. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for beginner guitar player
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for beginner guitar player. Slightly larger than standard 3/4 size steel string. Construction and sound quality are wonderful for the price. I have no regrets buying this for my daughter.
customer_reviews.author: BigWaterPapa

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Great beginner guitar! We got for my seven year old but I find it easy to use as well!
customer_reviews.author: Ash

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for 10 year old granddaughter. She loved it. The quality is very good and it sounds great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: big sound in a smaller package
customer_reviews.text: This is very good looking guitar with finishing equal to a fine instrucment. The intonation is perfect and that was a pleasant surprize. It has a forthright tone, more like a larger guitar. My only reservation is that the size is not clear. I thought it was a half size. It is actually slightly larger and would not fit in my case. I recommend this for mature classical players as an excellent travel guitar.
customer_reviews.author: Jay R. Strisik

customer_reviews.title: Great little guitar
customer_reviews.text: Nice size for children or adults with small hands. Excellent quality for the price. Looks good and sounds good too!
customer_reviews.author: BillG

customer_reviews.title: Excellent warm sound and comfortable neck
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely perfect, my kid loves it, so do i, excellent warm sound
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worst product of Yamaha
customer_reviews.text: Brought it for my son, cheap quality material, no truss rod in neck.
customer_reviews.author: Dheeraj Dubey

customer_reviews.title: Bad strings
customer_reviews.text: Sounds bad. Gonna try new strings. Hopefully that will help.
customer_reviews.author: Sol Sebastian

customer_reviews.title: CGS102A: Ordered classical, received acoustic
customer_reviews.text: So I’m confused. After much research, I ordered the 1⁄2 size CGS102A, because everything I’ve read, including amazon, said it’s nylon strings. Am I the only one who received an acoustic with metal strings?
customer_reviews.author: Tolga Sakman

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Perfect guitar for 6 year old taking lessons. Sound quality is great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: sound could be better
customer_reviews.text: The size is perfect, I really like the fact that I can bring in my roadtrips and camping trips, however, the sound is not as great as my other yamaha. I don't find myself very excited to play it at home compare to my other guitars.
customer_reviews.author: Clara L.

customer_reviews.title: Yamaha is still the best for learning classical guitar
customer_reviews.text: Arrives in perfect condition. Sounds great but gets out of tune after a few days. I’m assuming its due to new strings. I’ve used Yamaha as a kid so this sounds as I expected. Perfect for learning!
customer_reviews.author: DavisOnline

customer_reviews.title: Great guitar for kids
customer_reviews.text: Yamaha makes well-crafted guitars, even at this level. I am a guitarist myself, and I'm pretty impressed with this. The tone is great for a half size, and it'll certainly last them until I can pass down my own old full-size student Yamaha.
customer_reviews.author: Jarlimane

customer_reviews.title: Can’t beat the quality compared to price!
customer_reviews.text: Sounds great & good quality! And it’s just the right fit for my 6 year old niece.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda Thornton

customer_reviews.title: It is a beautiful little student model
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this item for my 7-yr-old grandson. It is a beautiful little student model, the half-size is perfect for him, it plays easily and stays well tuned! I recommend it for young students!
customer_reviews.author: Leo_Sngs

customer_reviews.title: It's really nice
customer_reviews.text: Our kid loves the guitar and it's a really good fit for his size (he's 6)
customer_reviews.author: JennA

customer_reviews.title: High quality music instrument.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome music instrument. I am no professional, but it sounds great.
customer_reviews.author: Leonardo Wassermann

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Really good quality without much cost. The strings are soft and easy to play. It's worthy.
customer_reviews.author: Ching

customer_reviews.title: Great little guitar
customer_reviews.text: Love it, but dislike the strings without a stopper on the end. Makes them harder to change.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel

customer_reviews.title: Wooden instrument over internet 🤔
customer_reviews.text: Tried two local stores for the same guitars. None of them had decent one. Decided to order them from Amazon. Unexpectedly Both where in good condition, and they sound good. Never thought that I will get classical guitar without holding it. Grand kids first guitar and they are not exited. Looks like they enjoye my guitars more. Also remember, it looks like Yamaha has NO quality control in products that are not built in Japan.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Good for beginners
customer_reviews.text: I wish it came with a strap and some fret guides, but I knew it didn't when I ordered. It has been great for my child.
customer_reviews.author: NBravo

customer_reviews.title: Quality and full fingerboard
customer_reviews.text: Nice action and sound - got it for the grandkids but tempting for travel!
customer_reviews.author: Linda Rosequist

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful guitar and sounds great!  Perfect for my 6 year old granddaughter!
customer_reviews.text: Great experience! This beautiful little guitar came in a short amount of time in excellent condition-no flaws at all. And it sounds beautiful! I have an old Ventura classical and this looks like its baby...It fits my six year old granddaughter perfectly and she loves it! I bought this guitar because of the positive reviews that I read.
customer_reviews.author: Constance S. Cunningham

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Fast delivery looks nice but can’t tone it,different people have tried 👎🏽
customer_reviews.author: E.M.

customer_reviews.title: Great guitar for toddlers
customer_reviews.text: Our son loves the guitar. The nylon strings are easier on his hands. It is still a bit big for him but he is only 5. There is plenty of room to grow into the guitar. We weren't sure if the price is worth it but after using it for a few months I would definitely say yes. If your kids are interested in learning guitar this is a great way to go.
customer_reviews.author: VM

customer_reviews.title: nice sound. my 5
customer_reviews.text: nice sound. my 5.5 year old loves it so far, holds it comfortably and can grow into it for the next 5-6 years
customer_reviews.author: Jehane

customer_reviews.title: Great Guitar! I recommend to anyone for a child
customer_reviews.text: Very good instrument. bought it for my son and it's as ever good as my full size guitar. I'd buy another for sure!
customer_reviews.author: hachadwick

customer_reviews.title: Excellent student instrument.
customer_reviews.text: We really like this guitar for a student to learn on - right size for small hands, has very good tone and registration, and is nicely finished. I wish it had an end pin, and it would be nice if there was a strap button option, but we can deal with that. We have now purchased 3 of these for different grandchildren. All have been great.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Sounds good, tunes well and fits 8 year old.
customer_reviews.text: Got this for granddaughter. She's got the string names down already, and a 3 string C, G, Em. Having fun learning to tune. And likes the gig bag that goes with it. She had a "toy" model guitar and I offered to trade this one. Tough call, and she tried negotiating to keep them BOTH. Is this a budding guitarist or what!? The frets are flat and tuning true. Sounds like a real guitar, just smaller.
customer_reviews.author: Pete A

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality and Excellent Finish
customer_reviews.text: Awesome little guitar for a child. Takes the discomfort out of learning to play guitar at an early age. Would recommend to anyone who has musically inclined children.
customer_reviews.author: Roman

customer_reviews.title: Good but not perfect
customer_reviews.text: The first day I got this guitar I was super happy as it's perfect for me. I just started learning about a month prior to purchase and I'm travelling so I needed a smaller for factor. The reason it's a low rating is because the strings are frayed and basically ruined and I've only had it a few weeks.. strings are an important part of a guitar an for the strings to c**p out after so little use is very disappointing...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great size for a small kid
customer_reviews.text: My 5 year old is learning guitar, so we got him the half size for practice. It’s the perfect size for him, plays beautifully, and holds its tune, so long as my son isn’t strumming to rough. I would recommend it. Note that it does not come with a strap holder
customer_reviews.author: ember

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Love this guitar. Perfect for my small hand. Nice sound.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Yamaha CGS102A Half-Size Classical Guitar - Natural
product_meta.description: Size:1/2 Size| Style:GuitarYamaha CGS Classical Guitars are great instruments for students learning the ins and outs of classical guitar technique. The guitars feature a spruce top, Mercanti back and sides, a nato neck and a rosewood bridge and fingerboard. Yamaha is famous for producing great-sounding budget classical guitars, and the CGS instruments will reward the learner with years of musical pleasure.
feature_bullets: Strings scale 25.6 inches, body depth 3.15 - 3.3 inches, finger board width (Nut/Body) 2.05 inches

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars151 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
